status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dt2ct","text":"Administer sodium pentobarbital through intraperitoneal injection.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2kl3e","text":"Place mouse back in the cage long enough for anesthesia to take effect.  Apply a hard toe pinch until mouse no longer reacts, ensuring that the mouse can no longer feel pain before proceeding.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7m2ki","text":"Place mouse, abdomen-up, on Styrofoam block. Spray mouse abdomen with 70% ethanol.  Grasp skin below ribcage with forceps and cut skin with scissors from middle up either side towards the armpits, cutting through ribcage. Diaphragm should carefully be cut circumferentially.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"51nk2","text":"Remove pericardium and peripheral fat to expose heart.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8d3m","text":"Insert the needle into the left ventricle and secure it with vascular clamp. Make a small incision on the right atrium using fine scissors.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"81sp6","text":"Start the saline perfusion for   at a constant speed of ~ /10 s.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":31,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":57,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":420,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d6nmr","text":"Following perfusion, open the abdomen of the mouse, remove and collect the stomach and duodenum.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9afvm","text":"Place the organs   in a tube containing HBSS solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":17,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":165}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c7v5l","text":"Open the stomach by cutting on the lesser curvature and open the duodenum along the mesentery line. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8pp8g","text":"Wash the tissue in HBSS solution in a petri dish to clean and remove the food.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3uotq","text":"Place the tissue in a Petri dish coated with Sylgard and orient it mucosa up.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"q1r7","text":"Grasp the right and left edges of the tissue and pin with 0.20 mm pins.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7gavj","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"33lc5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"d7ese","text":"The tissues should be stretched.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bif87","text":"Fix the tissue in 4% PFA   at   in the Petri dish coated with Sylgard.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":25,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":30,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":420,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":["overnight"],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"egjig","text":"Wash in PBS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a0r3d","text":"Unpin the tissue and keep it stored at   in 1X PBS containing 0.1% Sodium Azide (NaN3) before dissecting.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":84,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":39,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1al4q","text":"Wash in PBS for  . (1/5)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":16,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ft6ul","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1o27u","text":"Wash in PBS for  . (2/5)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":16,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"39AA7895530711EE8EDC0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"nh1c","text":"Wash in PBS for  . (3/5)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":16,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"3C2FB840530711EE8EDC0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d4n9r","text":"Wash in PBS for  . (4/5)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":16,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"3E2A35B6530711EE8EDC0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aoraq","text":"Wash in PBS for  . (5/5)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":16,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"40FEDF6D530711EE8EDC0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

steps.section: Microdissection of longitudinal muscle and myenteric plexus
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ctrn8","text":"Add PBS 1X to a Petri dish coated with Sylgard, place the tissue on it and orient tissue with the mucosal layer facing up. Grasp the right and left edges of the tissue and pin them.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7nqv0","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6qaes","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8aj1v","text":" The tissues have to be stretched.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Microdissection of longitudinal muscle and myenteric plexus
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1k6ut","text":"Under a stereo microscope, scratch the mucosa with the back of curved forceps. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Microdissection of longitudinal muscle and myenteric plexus
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ad24","text":"Using forceps with fine tips, remove the mucosal and submucosal layer until you expose the circular muscle. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Microdissection of longitudinal muscle and myenteric plexus
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1pkk2","text":"Peel away the circular muscle with fine forceps to uncover the myenteric plexus.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Microdissection of longitudinal muscle and myenteric plexus
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2itjr","text":"With a micro-scissor, cut small segments of the dissected tissue containing the longitudinal muscle and the myenteric plexus (LMMP).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Microdissection of longitudinal muscle and myenteric plexus
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7jvs6","text":"Store the LMMP preparation at   in 1X PBS containing 0.1% Sodium Azide (NaN3) until performing immunofluorescence.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":75,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":30,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bl0vo","text":"In a 96-well plate, add   of blocking solution containing 0.1% PBS/NaN3, 10% FBS and 0.5% Triton X-100 per well needed for the number of tissues. Using fine forceps, transfer each tissue into a separate well with the blocking solution and incubate for   at   on a shaker.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":70,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":24,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":252,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":257,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"200","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":7200,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":32}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"918ph","text":"Dilute primary antibodies in the blocking solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5uc3r","text":"Add   of primary antibodies solution in new empty wells, transfer each tissue in separate wells and incubate with the primary antibodies   at   on a shaker.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":137,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":142,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9pfco","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"200","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":7200,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":["overnight"],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eqmca","text":"Wash in PBS 1X (by adding   of PBS 1X in new wells and transferring each tissue separately).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":26,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1p02h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"200","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"d99lg","text":"Dilute secondary antibodies at 1:500 in the blocking buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b0hhk","text":"Add   of secondary antibodies solution in new empty wells, transfer each tissue in separate wells and incubate for   at   on a shaker.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":115,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":120,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3d740","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"200","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":7200,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":32}}}}
